snippet: New York City’s potter’s field is run by the Correction Department and visits are restricted, involve paperwork and are limited to relatives.
abstract: Bill to transfer control of Hart Island from New York City Dept of Corrections to Parks and Recreation Dept meets opposition from all agencies affected at City Council hearing; 101-acre island serves as city's only potter's field, and parks dept officials say administration of public cemetery falls well outside its purview.
lead_paragraph: New York City’s potter’s field is run by the Correction Department and visits are restricted, involve paperwork and are limited to relatives.

headline.main: Officials Object to Plan to Turn Hart Island Burial Site Over to Parks Dept.
headline.print_headline: Officials Criticize Proposal to Turn Potter’s Field Over to Parks Dept.
